intro: Alsine villarii, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces tiny white or pink flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. It is adapted to thrive in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed or dry habitats. Alsine villarii is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to stabilize soils in harsh environments.
